body: Invoking `Buffer::compact` on large buffers will also introduce `EventHandler` jitter and will severely impact CPU caching efficiency.
A relatively simple solution would be to create a round-robin use of `Bytes` which would have several benefits including not having to use `underlying()` at all.
@minborg I see you have done some work on this can we close it ? Otherwise please outline what else is remaining to do.
@glukos this is not a priority at the moment, but when you get back to network enterprise could you also consider this issue. Thanks.
Once you start with this @glukos, I could provide some additional background information as well as ideas I had in the past with regards to the issue at hand.
See the branch feature/doublebuffer for how I initially thought to solve this

@minborg I don't see this branch anymore.  
Since ring buffer is a commercial feature we cannot use it unless implement something similar. Do we want this?
I think this issue is important to fix. I think the branch was removed. Perhaps it is better to start afresh since this issue was written in 2020
